citation.article-title: Krokinobacter gen. nov., with three novel species, in the family Flavobacteriaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Krokinobacter eikastus sp. nov.
Krokinobacter eikastus (ei.kas′tus. N.L. masc. adj. eikastus from Gr. masc. adj. eikastos similar, comparable).
The species displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
The optimal growth temperature is 20 °C and the optimal salt concentration is 3 %.
Colonies are slightly convex and yellowish on marine agar 2216.
Mannitol is utilized, but acetate is not utilized.
The cellular fatty acids include arachidonic acid.
The DNA G+C content is 38 mol%.
The type strain is PMA-26T (=NBRC 100814T=CIP 108743T), isolated from marine sediment collected at Kisarazu, Japan.
